identificationModule.briefTitle: Cerebral Blood Flow: Helmet vs Oronasal Mask During Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Variation of Cerebral Blood Flow Depending on the Interface Chosen During Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Ventilation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In this trial the investigators will evaluate blood flow in common carotid artery of healthy subjects treated with Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) Ventilation, comparing two different devices: oronasal mask versus Helmet. The hypothesis is that Helmet CPAP reduces carotid flow compared to oronasal mask.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Open Label, randomized, controlled with crossover

armGroups.label: Helmet
armGroups.description: Partecipants will be started on Continuous Positive Airway Pressure using the Helmet interface
interventionNames: Device: Helmet Continuous Positive Airway Pressure

armGroups.label: Oronasal Mask
armGroups.description: Partecipants will be started on Continuous Positive Airway Pressure using the oronasal mask interface
interventionNames: Device: Oronasal Mask Continuous Positive Airway Pressure

interventions.name: Helmet Continuous Positive Airway Pressure
interventions.description: Partecipants will be started on Continuous Positive Airway Pressure at 10 cmH2O on inspired fraction of oxygen (FiO2)= 21% with the Helmet interface for a duration of 5 minutes while laying down on a stretcher with head elevated at 60°

interventions.name: Oronasal Mask Continuous Positive Airway Pressure
interventions.description: Partecipants will be started on Continuous Positive Airway Pressure at 10 cmH2O on Inspired fraction of oxygen (FiO2)= 21% with the oronasal mask interface for a duration of 5 minutes while laying down on a stretcher with head elevated at 60°

primaryOutcomes.description: Left common carotid artery flow, expressed as ml/min measured with pulsed wave doppler with ultrasound
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 consecutive heart beats at the end of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Non invasive mean arterial blood pressure on left arm
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: single measure, at the end of the intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Peripheral vascular resistance measured in left common carotid artery, measured with pulsed wave doppler with ultrasound
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 consecutive heart beats at the end of the intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years,
* Ability to give informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* known cardiac pathologies
* known pulmonary pathologies
* known vascular pathologies
* history of concussion
* history of headache
